website_summaries.verdict: Formulated for balanced energy and packed with superfoods, this food-based multivitamin offers daily benefits.
pros: Made with organic fruits and vegetables
Includes superfoods such as spirulina, acai berry, goji berry, pomegranate extract, beet, and kale
Traditional herbs for balanced energy such as rhodiola, dong quai, and green tea
No artificial preservatives, colors, flavors, or sweeteners

customer_reviews.title: Not the one a day
customer_reviews.text: I usually get the Women’s One and ordered these by mistake. Just wanted to note for others that you have to take four of these a day, so they cost about $1/day. They also do not have as much of each nutrient in them as the one a day (and they do not have any calcium).
customer_reviews.author: M. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Read serving amount before you purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have taken rainbow lite vitamins for years. I bought this bottle, 120 count, thinking it was a three month supply. I opened it, noticed it was capsules rather than the usual vitamin, then read the directions and it says you have to take FOUR per day. I cannot return it since I opened it, but read carefully before you purchase. Otherwise love the rainbow lite brand
customer_reviews.author: Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Best Women's Multi I have found so far
customer_reviews.text: I really like this supplement. After using it for a while I thought I'll try something a bit less expensive and regretted that decision almost immediately. I had "expensive urine" while on the other brand, i.e. most of the vitamins were being flushed out without being absorbed. I also didn't feel as good as I used too with the Rainbow brand. After using up the bottle, I went right back to Rainbow. It is really true that you get what you pay for. The little extra expense it well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Instant Heartburn
customer_reviews.text: I normally order the Rainbow Light Prenatal One - which I love. I accidentally got these organic ones. The first problem is that you have to take 4 capsules a day. That's too many for me. Plus, they give me heart burn within minutes. I even get heartburn when I just take 2 at a time. Now, I'll admit, I'm pregnant and get heartburn more often, but the Prenatal One (or calcium or folic acid) do not give me heartburn. And they are really stinky. Early in my pregnancy I had a strong aversion to smells and the smell of these made me gag. Get the Prenatal One instead!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great prenatals you can trust!
customer_reviews.text: I love these prenatals! I was taking the mini-tablets and absolutley hated the smell of them and the after taste they left in my mouth. These however are capsules and have no aftertaste or smell to them and are very easy to swallow. I have always trusted Rainbowlight, and will continue to use them when I'm breastfeeding. Currently 25+1 and have a healthy growing baby!
customer_reviews.author: calebandRR

customer_reviews.title: This vitamin is WORTH every penny!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first vitamin, in all my vitamin sampling years, that actually made a noticeable difference in the way I feel. This product actually makes me feel energized after each dose. I was also impressed that I could take it on an empty stomach with NO nausea! Yay! I will definitely repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: squirrelmomma

customer_reviews.title: I gave this item four stars because I feel amazing, but it's difficult to swallow four of these ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not pregnant, but I've been taking prenatals for low iron for years now (probably the past 10 years & it works for me. I could feel the difference immediately after switching from the walmart non-organic vitamins to these. I gave this item four stars because I feel amazing, but it's difficult to swallow four of these per day. They don't feel good going down & I have a slight metallic taste in my mouth. I don't think I could do it if I was pregnant, but that's the only downside to these vitamins- attempting to swallow them 4 times per day (bleh!). I think I will get the one a day version on my next purchase.
customer_reviews.author: shante708

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff.
customer_reviews.text: I've been taking this vitamin for several years now and I'm very happy with it. I like that it has all of the stuff you'd expect in a multi-vitamin, plus digestive enzymes, and women's specific other good stuff. For me, it has just the right amount of "stuff", and in a good balance with everything. Not too much of anything, but just enough to keep me feeling good.
customer_reviews.author: Karen L.

customer_reviews.title: Not 1 a day prenatal!!! Would NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Thought I was buying the one a day tablets that I’ve previously purchased. These are 4 capsules a day & the amount per serving are pretty different as well. Even with 4 capsules you still aren’t meeting recommended daily amount of several vitamins! The description on this item is misleading when listing the vitamins it contains as well (says there’s more vitamin A etc.) The capsules do make it much easier to swallow and therefore don’t taste the pill as much as the tablets. But they’re also providing less nutrients, need to take more of them, & cost more per serving I would NOT recommend!
customer_reviews.author: adreger

customer_reviews.title: The best for my needs! Review my be TMI...
customer_reviews.text: Update: I am really upset that the subscribe and save option is no longer available for this specific vitamin. I have PCOS and recently didn't have a menstrual cycle for 80 days. Went to the doctor for bloodwork.. thyroid and prolactin were normal so she prescribed Provera. I've never been one to take added hormone pills like birth control, which my doctor suggests I take to regulate my PCOS. I started taking these vitamins and two week later and BAM. To add, I feel better over all. I love these vitamins.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. SSS

customer_reviews.title: Great product but the container...
customer_reviews.text: I always buy this brand, however I was a bit uneasy because the tinfoil on the top was open...thought to myself well maybe it just came unglued...however when I pulled it off the rest of the way it appeared as if the cotton was pushed over a bit. I don’t have time to return the product because I need them now.hmmm...made me nervous. I’m keeping them this time only...
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Love that they are organic but 4pills
customer_reviews.text: While it is the consumer's responsibility to read the packaging, I was shocked to realize that I should be taking 4pills daily to get my daily vitamin! I bought a slightly different version of this product (they were not available when I re-ordered a refill) that was once tablet a day. Love that they are organic but 4pills?! I did not think that was noted enough on the front of the packaging and in small print where it says "serving size" on that back you realize you only get a full dose of your daily vitamins/supplements if you take 4pills! Expensive and inconvenient. Easy to miss that 120 pills is only a one month supply at 4pills per day.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: NEED TO TAKE 4 A DAY
customer_reviews.text: It has all the things I want but you have to take four a day which I didn’t notice when I ordered it
customer_reviews.author: dina vigil

customer_reviews.title: Caused 5day Headache
customer_reviews.text: Did tons of research and decided on these vitamins since they had everythung I needed. After 2 days of taking them (all 4) i developed a terrible throbbing headache, that medicine and sleep wouldnt touch. Stopped taking the vitamin (the only thing i had changed) and it took 5days for the headache to go away. Decided to try again with only 1 pill a day to see if it was just too much at once. Headache came back on the 2nd day. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Fymonkey

customer_reviews.title: You need four of these a day...
customer_reviews.text: These are not the same as their old tablet version. You need to take four of these to get the daily dose so this is a one month supply, which is a an outrageous cash grab. Also they decreased the vitamin amounts significantly. This product contains no calcium or magnesium which is an automatic fail in itself, but they also reduced the vitamin D.
customer_reviews.author: Ladle Lady

customer_reviews.title: Great product that provides everything you need! Got pregnant right away - two times!
customer_reviews.text: I started taking the Prenatal Multivitamins one year before I wanted to get pregnant - because they provide everything the body needs on a daily basis! When we decided to get pregnant we didn't have to try twice :-) We got pregnant right away! I never stopped taking them. After my first pregnancy, we got pregnant right away AGAIN! Due to the Prenatal Multivitamins or not... I love them and I still take them even though I'm not planning to get pregnant again.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Very healthy choice
customer_reviews.text: They're a tough act to swallow. Taking 4 at once is pretty difficult. I may switch to gummies just because im tired of them making me nauseous. But the ingredients are amazing. I can't tell much a difference in energy just yet. But I would recommend as long as you can stomach them! Update- they came one short. Definitely switching to gummies.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Swaim

customer_reviews.title: Not good for me
customer_reviews.text: I started taking the pills, however, throughout this week I noticed that I get stomach ache, , I felt very sore, swollen, heartburn and discomfort in general. Made me gassy and stomach upset. Then I left them and I've been better. I am very sorry because I was sincerely looking for a supplement like this.
customer_reviews.author: Nohemi

customer_reviews.title: This product is not the real thing. I also ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is not the real thing. I also bought in store and the total package is wrong. The label and sealing. It made me get cotton mouth and dry scalp
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I want to take this!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this company and their nutrient profiles but every time that I these....I get heartburn! (and I'm not a person who gets heartburn...ever) I took the prenatal vitamins and the same thing happened but only towards the end of my pregnancy. I just chalked it up to babes taking up too much room, but I have the same thing happen with these. :( I would recommend these over others just because of the non-gmo, vegan etc. plus awesome vitamins/minerals included in this to anyone who could take them. I'm still devising ways to be able to take these, so I'm not giving up yet.
customer_reviews.author: Alana

customer_reviews.title: When I bought this I didn’t realize that it had ...
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this I didn’t realize that it had a Chinese herb that could interfere with my birth control. So I gave it to my sister.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Almendarez

customer_reviews.title: Dont Buy this product every very bad product, waist of money
customer_reviews.text: Dont Buy this product every very bad product , waist of money . I ordered this 20 days back. After taking this vitamin my stomach start paining and i got stomach upset. It says to take 4 capsule but all are so big and looks and taste artificial . Worst multivitamin
customer_reviews.author: Ashish

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these vitamins. Yes you do have to take 4 of them, but I usually only take 3 and I feel like that is sufficient. They never upset my stomach and are pretty easy to take. I did a ton of research trying to find Non-GMO, Organic, Whole Food vitamins and these fit the bill. They are also very easy on your stomach, other brand multivitamins always made me throw-up. With these I have no problems and they are actually pretty affordable if you buy them here on amazon. They are about twice as much at my local health food store. Great price here on amazon and great product!
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Good product, high price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, natural prenatal that did not cause any discomfort for me. Unfortunately, I found it difficult to remember to take multiple pills each day. Also, the price is high for 1 month worth of prenatals. Although I live a very natural lifestyle, I still need to try to balance that lifestyle with the price. I started taking prenatals a few months before trying to conceive and plan to continue to take prenatals for breastfeeding (1-2 years). The price for taking these for 2-3 years for each child is just too expensive for our family.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole D.

customer_reviews.title: Great multivitamin, easy to take
customer_reviews.text: I switched from Rainbow Light's Women's One to this one, Women's Multivitamin. The Women's one didn't come in a capsule and was a bit bigger and slightly more difficult to swallow. The women's multivitamin comes in an easier to swallow capsule. I take it on weekdays, and use it as my multivitamin. The only downside is the price has gone up since I last bought it!
customer_reviews.author: d_nique

customer_reviews.title: Gentle on my stomach, but difficult to swallow
customer_reviews.text: I have a very sensitive stomach, and can't take most vitamins. I can take these with NO problems. I sometimes only take 2-3 a day instead of 4, but now that we are trying to have a baby I've been trying to take all four. They get stuck in my throat every time. EVERY TIME. However, I plan ahead and just make sure I have some food or something else to swallow after I take them to push them all the way down. Other than that... they are amazing. I have only been sick twice since I started taking them two years ago, and I have a child in preschool! This is a major improvement over past years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Serving size: 4 Capsules?!
customer_reviews.text: I mistakenly thought the organic prenatal was the same as the prenatal one I had been taking, only organic. It was a week before I realized the serving size is 4 capsules (shame on me for not reading the label). Then if you read 'Suggested Usage' it says 2-4 capsules. So how many am I supposed to take? Since the suggested dose is for 4 capsules I have to assume the vitamin dosage is based on 4 capsules but this isn't completely clear to me. When I compare the ingredients list it is also lower for most of vitamins than the one-a-day. I will definitely be going back to the one-a-day when I'm done with this bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Maine-iak

customer_reviews.title: I really love these vitamins
customer_reviews.text: I really love these vitamins. I started researching quality organic vitamins a year ago in order to get rid of warts I was starting to get on my legs. I started eating very healthy and taking these vitamins and the warts disappeared. I have since, unfortunately, stopped eating as healthy but I'm still taking these vitamins and still having great results.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I switched to this vitamin from the traditional Rainbow Light because of the possibility of GMOs. My midwives actually liked the ingredients in this one better than the traditional one and it doesn't have any soy, wheat, or gluten. It no longer includes the American Ginseng within its ingredients (based on previous reviews). I actually like these better because they are capsules and not the tablet form. If you're having nausea, it might be better to take this with something to eat after (toast, crackers) just because you can get a taste of it when you burp (blah). And take a calcium supplement with it. =)
customer_reviews.author: Alana

customer_reviews.title: Best prenatal vitamins
customer_reviews.text: These are the best prenatal vitamins! It comes in capsule shape and easy to swallow. These are perfect for pregnancy days!
customer_reviews.author: Muski87

customer_reviews.title: Rainbow Light is a great product, highly recommended for those with Fibromyalgia
customer_reviews.text: Rainbow Light is a great product, highly recommended for those with Fibromyalgia. I can feel the difference when taking these as opposed to other multivitamins. I have more energy, and less pain. Good value, as well.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: (Women's Organic Multivitamin) These are the best multivitamins I've ever tried, by far. A vegetarian capsule instead of a yucky tablet. No smell, no taste. As a super duper added bonus, they don't make me ill if I take them on an empty stomach. I haven't been taking them for very long but I've noticed a difference in the way I feel already. I hope they make them forever because I never want another multivitamin!
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: She takes them at the end of her meal or mid way through her meal for best absorption.
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves these vitamins. When she forgets to take them (which is rare) she can tell. She takes them at the end of her meal or mid way through her meal for best absorption.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Certified Organic but serving size is 4 capsules
customer_reviews.text: Ok but it says to take 4, and then you get over 1000% of RDV for the B vitamins and 50% of Vitamin A, for example. It's difficult to find a certified organic vitamin though so I may have to buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yummy in my Tummy!
customer_reviews.text: I am not pregnant, but my plan is to eventually become pregnant in the next year or more. So, my doctor advised that I start taking prenatal pills to "prepare" my body. I found these looking for a whole foods approach in vitamin supplementation. I'm happy with my choice, these are easy to swallow, and are gel-capped, which lets me know they will dissolve in my gut. I only take two a day (recommendation is four if you are pregnant), and I find that I'm not so foggy mentally as the day progresses, for that I am grateful.
customer_reviews.author: Sweetlyke_me

customer_reviews.title: Easy to swallow and good ingredients...no upset tumnp
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't make me sick if taken on a empty stomach. Great ingredients what's bit to love
customer_reviews.author: Lele89

customer_reviews.title: Soy free and gentle on stomach!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these after looking for a soy free vitamin while nursing. My newborn son is extremely gassy, fussy and colicky, so I decided to eliminate dairy and soy from my diet to see if that helped him. After noticing my prenatal vitamin contained soy, I decided to buy these. I am always very nervous when trying a new vitamin because different vitamins often give me nausea and vomitting, but I did not have any problems with these. You do have to take 4 caps to get one serving, but they are very easy to swallow, and I am actually able to take all 4 at once.
customer_reviews.author: SuSlish

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: This was the first "Rainbow Light" product I had and I loved it! Unfortunately I don't use it for "prenatal" reasons.. I'm just trying to make my hair skin and nails look healthier/grow faster and stronger. Its great for me because I can take two on days where I got more Iron in my food than I anticipated... other times I can take three because it gives you the full serving of Iron that you need... but honestly I love it for its B vitamins and would recommend this and many other Rainbow Light products. I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Mermie

customer_reviews.title: Read the ingredients and speak with your physician!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is horrible, potent amounts of vitamins is an understatement! My face broke out, developed rash & hives, muscle pain & cramping. Absolutely the worst product! If I could give this product a zero I would!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Prenatal I’ve found! You want CAPSULES
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! I was taking Orthomolecular Prenatals and they work great but the taste/smell started to become too much the further into my pregnancy I got. I take these along with Oceans Mom DHA liquid capsules and the combination has been great for me and baby so far! I am 7 months along and highly recommend. The dissolvability is very important so the fact that they are capsules vs tablets is a huge plus. One serving size is 4 capsules but that is nothing knowing what they are doing for your baby and yourself!
customer_reviews.author: Kara Crespo

customer_reviews.title: Great vitamin!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always been a huge fan of their products. It’s very gentle on the stomach and it keeps me feeling at ease knowing I’m getting my essential nutrients daily by taking his multi vitamin. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Venus A Smith

customer_reviews.title: ode to vitamins
customer_reviews.text: vegan athletes need nutrition too easy to swallow, this pills will do. nails and hair grow fast and thick. for vitamins, these really do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: CatLoversUnite

customer_reviews.title: Only been using for week and notice a positive difference ...
customer_reviews.text: Only been using for week and notice a positive difference in the way I feel. I have a sensitive stomach to most vitamins and I can take these on an empty stomach without becoming sick. Update: since I've continued to use these vitamins, they continue to make me feel amazing, which gives me more energy. Wouldn't use any other vitamin. (They're also half price on Amazon)
customer_reviews.author: E-Mac

customer_reviews.title: 100% Organic
customer_reviews.text: I have a chronic illness and I was losing my hair, my hormones were unbalanced. However, sense I have been taking these vitamins my health has improved. My hair is strong and growing again, I never imagined prenatal vitamins could have this effect on my health. 5 stars. P.S. Take them sparingly for optimal results if you aren't pregnant. I take them every other two days.
customer_reviews.author: VeaBea

customer_reviews.title: Feel great, more energized
customer_reviews.text: I feel amazing since taking these. I'm not very good at eating all the required fruits and vegetables I'm supposed to daily. So I really feel like these are helping me get the nutrition I need. At least more than I used to before taking these. Easy to swallow, easy on on the stomach, no foul smells like some vitamins.I just don't like I have to take 4 a day.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy2_1

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love these vitamins ❤️ I have been taking these vitamins for several months will buy over and over again!
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Never vomited-pregnant with twins
customer_reviews.text: I'm pregnant with twins and I did have a little nausea in my first trimester at night. I would take these pills 2 in the morning and 2 after noon. I'm pretty sure these pills are the reason I never vomited. From what I hear most twin pregnancies result in extra nausea. I think the B6 and the Ginger helped me tremendously.
customer_reviews.author: LKayS

customer_reviews.title: Not the same
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after running out of the Rainbow Light Women's One which I always take. Similar ingredients and quantity and same brand. Well I ended up feeling horrible because they obviously did not work like their sister vitamins. I'm so sad and disappointed for the money
customer_reviews.author: liz

customer_reviews.title: another great brand another great product
customer_reviews.text: This company is one of my favorites to use. I buy many supplements from them.
customer_reviews.author: maggie

customer_reviews.title: Nice organic multi!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a hard time finding an organic multi that doesnt contain mega doses of vitamins. This one is very nice and since the dose is divided between 4 caps I can customize the amount I want to take each day without feeling like a mega dose it doing more harm than good. A nice multi that I will continue to purchase...
customer_reviews.author: JillU

customer_reviews.title: Great & Easy on the Stomach!
customer_reviews.text: These are the only vitamins I've found that are vegetarian friendly and easy to digest. Most supplements make me nauseated, so I stop taking them after a day or two. These are great and don't bother my stomach at all! I am already on my second bottle and will continue to take these for the foreseeable future!
customer_reviews.author: m.c.

customer_reviews.title: Only 30 servings... don’t be fooled
customer_reviews.text: One serving is 4 capsules / day, so the 120 capsule bottle only contains a 30 day supply. The second picture with the nutrition label does show this, but I think the written description would more clearly call this out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These multivitamins help me feel better
customer_reviews.text: I've taken a number of multivitamins in my life, some general, some for women. These, I feel a good difference. I let myself run out of them once to see if I noticed a difference in energy levels when I wasn't taking them. I did. So I ordered them again and will continue to take them.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Severino

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: My friend who purchased this product on Amazon recommended it. I have neglected to take any vitamins all my life and at 30, I think I should! Better late than never! Love this product. I only take 2 pills a day (in the morning) and I have no major issues. I went to Whole Foods and the item was about $30. Good thing I bought it on AMAZON!
customer_reviews.author: DariK

customer_reviews.title: prefer the 1 a day
customer_reviews.text: rainbow is midwife recommended but I bought the 1 a day and she said to get the 4 a day instead as you're supposed to space out the pills vs taking it all at once and supposedly not being able to use so much with one dose. I like the 1 a day better. I had huge amounts of energy compared to not taking the 1 a day. these really did nothing for me that I noticed, tho nothing about taking them bothered me :/ everyone is different though
customer_reviews.author: TheThompsonMom

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Vitamins!
customer_reviews.text: I love that this is an organic and whole food vitamin. Doctor's will prescribe prescription prenatals that are made in a lab. Seems to make more sense that nutrition comes from the fruits and veggies we should be consuming anyway! I have been taking it for about a year and haven't even had a cold or any illness. Not even morning sickness! I believe it has kept me and my growing baby healthy. I recommend to all my pregnant friends.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: Over all a good vitamin. I feel great with it. But I do wish it had the methylated versions of the b vitamins instead. But that's my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Women's organic
customer_reviews.text: I have shopped around for many different organic vitamins. These are my favorites. They contain a lot of different items to help in a few areas. Some vitamins make my stomach hurt, but I have not had that problem with these. The only problem is that you are required to take four. I guess that is required for all of the ingredients. :) It is a good product and I will continue to order it in the future.
customer_reviews.author: idgirl4

customer_reviews.title: will continue to use
customer_reviews.text: I just started taking the woman's multivitamin. I some times have a hard time swallowing pills, what I really like about Rainbow light multivitamin is: they are certified organic, and the capsules are easy to open so I just open them up and pour them in my smoothie before I blend each morning
customer_reviews.author: Valerie King

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased so far!
customer_reviews.text: After getting some routine blood work, I found out I was deficient in several vitamins and minerals. I decided to try this, and I could tell a difference the very first day. It's been 2 weeks now, and I've not missed a day. I don't feel GREAT, but I feel a bit better, less lethargic, and my metabolism seems to be getting back to a more normal level, instead of slug speed. I'll update in another 2.
customer_reviews.author: Catniss Cat

customer_reviews.title: Best prenatal!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pregnancy and it's been much better than the first meaning, I haven't been sick at all. I completely thank these vitamins. I do gag just a bit while taking them but that's gone once they are down. Plus, no fishy taste like many other prenatal's. Buy these! Plus they are organic! Doesn't get much better. I looked at my local food health store and they were asking over $30. So I'm glad amazon has these wonderful things!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Finally!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a vitamin that doesn't bother my sensitive stomach! My doctor recently told me to start taking a daily iron and vitamin d, I searched every where to find something that would not upset my stomach or make me constipated. These do the trick! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle King

customer_reviews.title: Best ones yet!
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand and have started using the other vitamins they offer for my family. Once were done with the baby years and switch away from prenatal vitamins, I will stick with the brand. Happy customer here! :D
customer_reviews.author: LizK

customer_reviews.title: NO SOY, DAIRY....
customer_reviews.text: Love these. My son was having some protein intolerances around 3 months and these were my go to vitamin as they don't contain most allergens. You do have to take 4 for the full amount of vitamins listed. Most people get a good vitamin intake if they eat somewhat healthy so I only take two and it lasts longer. I can take them on an empty stomach as when with no side effects! I took the regular once a day vitamin they make but it contained soy.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Hoss88

customer_reviews.title: serving size 4 capsules (huge)
customer_reviews.text: Beware: The serving size listed on the package is 4 capsules, which is not true of all of the prenatal vitamins from rainbow light. In order to get the recommended folic acid, etc, one would need to take 4 huge caps daily, making this a very expensive prenatal vitamin.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Great service!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! Will certainly purchase again. Arrived quickly and in new condition!
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: Read the dosage... 4caps a day...
customer_reviews.text: Love the ingrediants, hate having to take 4 a day... and they are not small
customer_reviews.author: TM R.

customer_reviews.title: This is one of my favorite multivitamin brand as its made with organic product and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite multivitamin brand as its made with organic product and is easy on the stomach. However this one you have to eat about 2 a day... which sorta ends up being more pricey. I used to buy the prenatal kind and it worked s well for me. It was a good deal too.
customer_reviews.author: ReNeR

customer_reviews.title: 4 a day umm no thanks
customer_reviews.text: Love rainbow light but these are short on some of the daily requirements and you have to take FOUR a day. Who does that ??
customer_reviews.author: Ann Baker

customer_reviews.title: What's the deal Rainbow Light?
customer_reviews.text: Pictures indicate daily suggested dose is 2-4 daily once item arrived, suggested dose is 4 daily. Also the website says it should be taken in between or with a meal but product says it can be taken on an empty stomach.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: organic multi
customer_reviews.text: I love these multivitamins. I am a yoga teacher, reccovering from fibromyalgia, and I wanted an affordable organic multivitamin. Although I just started taking them, I very much like them and would recommend them to all, especially those who want to avoid GMOS in typical multivitamins.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Gatta

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: I love these. They are to date my favorite vitamins. I can feel the difference when I don't take them. I don't take the recommended four per day unless I'm feeling really crappy so they last a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: MissNat

customer_reviews.title: Bootleg
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if these are fake but these are caps, and rainbow mens have allways been pill form.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Make me feel great. Just bought another bottle
customer_reviews.text: Loves these. Hair any nails are growing very fast. Make me feel great. Just bought another bottle!
customer_reviews.author: Meg O

customer_reviews.title: I take 4 capsules as recommended daily in the morning and they don't upset my ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been taking these as a supplement for a few years now. It's difficult to quantify how exactly they improve my health but I take them just the same. I take 4 capsules as recommended daily in the morning and they don't upset my stomach.
customer_reviews.author: Somebodys Mother

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These don't upset my stomach like prenatals I took with my first two children. They melt pretty quickly. Unfortunately I found that out when I threw them back up 20 minutes or so after taking them. This was not caused by the pills, but rather by something I ate, The gelatin capsules had already broken open and started digesting. So these go to work quickly! Sorry for the TMI!
customer_reviews.author: A. King

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Used consistently through two pregnancies and breastfeeding without any issues
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: I have to pre-face by saying I just started taking ...
customer_reviews.text: I have to pre-face by saying I just started taking these and will see how I feel. My fault for now reading the serving suggestion, I was used to Rainbow Light One-A-Day and didn't realize these were 4 pills a day! It's a lot to take especially in the first trimester (when you're either nauseous because you're hungry or nauseous because you just ate). Also at $26 for 30 day supply it's over my budget, will be going back to Rainbow Light Prenatal One-A-Day
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never again!!
customer_reviews.text: Was extremely gassy, cramps, and bloating after taking them. And that wasn't even the worst part. All day & night I was so jittery! With migraines & like a dizziness feeling!! I have never felt like this! I thought this was gonna be an awesome product but it turned out to be the complete opposite!!
customer_reviews.author: Faviola Ornelas

customer_reviews.title: One a day please
customer_reviews.text: Didn't like how many I had to take. Felt like a waist of capsules
customer_reviews.author: CroseSmile

customer_reviews.title: Fine, but you have to take FOUR!
customer_reviews.text: I don't get any bad taste or upset stomach with these. I'm used the taking the "Prenatal One", so I didn't even realize until recently that I had to take FOUR of these! That's kind of a lot, so I'll be switching back to a kind that only requires me to take one large pill per day.
customer_reviews.author: sar0932

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: These are great. My energy, both emotional and physical improve when i take them along with fish oil, and dip when i forget for a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Such a waste! 4 pills for one dose!
customer_reviews.text: Ugh should've read the negative reviews. 4 tablets a day for the dosage! So this is only going to last name a month. Such a waste of money. Another reviewer mentioned they have a prenatal one vitamin, which is one dose per day. But it's a bit pricier and too late now due this first batch
customer_reviews.author: Allison Dibble

customer_reviews.title: These are very easy to swollen even with the constant stomach issues during ...
customer_reviews.text: These are very easy to swollen even with the constant stomach issues during pregnancy! They don't make me feel sick. They don't taste nasty. Yet I can tell I am getting the nutrients that I need.
customer_reviews.author: tiera

customer_reviews.title: Organic, plant-based multi-vitamin?  Count me IN!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just recently started taking this product and I can already see the difference in my skin and nails. I am always looking for organic products and, after searching for a while, I realized that there aren't very many organic whole foods multi-vitamins on the market right now. I have already recommended it to three friends.
customer_reviews.author: Christine M. Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again
customer_reviews.text: Honestly love how easy taking these pills is to get all my needed nutrients at once!
customer_reviews.author: kitty02

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional ingredients
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 4 stars because they do taste a little odd going down, but I have yet to find a brand as clean. And natural as this that doesn't have that same problem. If you want something that tastes like a treat for a prenatal, you have to compromise on ingredients. After a lot of reach this brand is the best on ingredients! Ad isn't that what is most important ?
customer_reviews.author: Amy E

customer_reviews.title: 4 Per Day Is A Lot
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to read the label better than I did - you have to take four of these per day.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry R.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product.
customer_reviews.text: We have used these vitamins for the past three years with our first child, and now our second. We have recommended them to other young families.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Patton

customer_reviews.title: organic vitamins
customer_reviews.text: Well i have to get use to these vitamins something very new to me and i am trying to adjust to them and today out of all the other days i feel great!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! the other days not to good but they are ok thanks again amazon you all did it again a At grade
customer_reviews.author: Sandra McGrady

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Nutrients from Natural Sources
customer_reviews.text: Great boost of energy from these, no nausea or stomach pain when taking them without food. It is hard for me to swallow capsules but I have no problem with these and they don't float back up. I really like that they are made from natural sources and not synthetic crap made in a lab.
customer_reviews.author: Shana L. Kuehn

customer_reviews.title: Other than that like them fine but 4 pills is a lot to ...
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased I didn't realize the serving size was 2-4 pills - how am I supposed to know how many to take? 2? 3? 4? Other than that like them fine but 4 pills is a lot to take.
customer_reviews.author: hdgolden

customer_reviews.title: No Calcium
customer_reviews.text: Careful mamas, this is a great product, but I called the company and they confirmed that there is no additional calcium in this one. Make sure you're getting it from other sources or take another supplement. Personally, I just make sure I'm getting enough in my diet and it seems to be working fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: JLW

customer_reviews.title: This is truly organic
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Rainbow Light Women's Organic Multivitamins for a couple of years. I've been purchasing it from a local health food store and never thought to check the pricing with amazon. It is cheaper on amazon.com than the health food store. I will stick with purchasing online at amazon.
customer_reviews.author: A. MORALES

customer_reviews.title: You have to take 4 capsuled per day and are ...
customer_reviews.text: You have to take 4 capsuled per day and are not to take it with meals. This makes it tough for me to remember to take them
customer_reviews.author: Catherine B.

customer_reviews.title: I stared taking this when started exercising and i thought ...
customer_reviews.text: I stared taking this when started exercising and i thought this might make me feel a little more energetic or different, but I feel no such difference. It has been a month. I don't think this make a difference in my lifestyle if I didn't take this anymore.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: These are okay. I thought I'd be alright with ...
customer_reviews.text: These are okay. I thought I'd be alright with taking it 4 times a day, but I started to forget when I took one last. And they started to make me feel nauseous. So I switched to the the Rainbow Light One Multivitamin and I'm on my third bottle!
customer_reviews.author: vlousabani

customer_reviews.title: Best one a day on the market
customer_reviews.text: Best one a day on the market! Has everything you need and easy to digest. A little more expensive but totally worth it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Organic plant based vitamins
customer_reviews.text: Good product, good quality ingredients. Would rather have a 1 a day tab than 4 tabs times/day.
customer_reviews.author: Gillian Cassel

customer_reviews.title: Best multivitamin
customer_reviews.text: This brand of vitamin is the best. You can very much tell a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Rainbow Light Women's Organic Multi, 120-Capsules
product_meta.description: Reach a stronger state of health with Rainbow Light Certified Women's Multivitamin (120 Vegetarian Capsules), a supplement formulated to renew, strengthen, and protect a woman's core body systems for lasting energy, vitality, and health. The comprehensive, food-based formula contains research-based nutrients combined with organic whole foods, such as spirulina, acai berry, pomegranate extract, beet, and kale. The easy-to-swallow vegetarian capsules also provide traditionally used herbs, including organic rhodiola, organic dong quai, and organic green tea, plus DIM, that fortify and protect the female system and promote balanced energy.
feature_bullets: FOOD BASED MULTIVITAMIN: Formulated specifically for women in an easily digestible formula with organic fruits and vegetables
SUPERFOOD ADDITIONS: Spirulina, acai berry, goji berry, pomegranate extract, beet, and kale are included for added health benefit
BALANCED ENERGY: Including traditionally used organic herbs such as rhodiola, dong quai, and green tea that fortify and protect the female system and promote balanced energy
SUSTAINABLE PACKAGING: 100% Post-Consumer recycled and recyclable bottles that are BPA-free, we take a stand for more ocean, less plastic
PURITY SAFEGUARD: Gluten and Soy Free made with natural, purity tested ingredients and NO artificial preservatives, colors, flavors or sweeteners
